line.comment: * Removing / ignoring signal doesn't seem to work well...
* Mordan3
* === KILLERLESS POSSIBLE ===
* ZH 2.0 - Phanon quest fails if colony ship dies before a sector has been given to Phanon
* Zero Hour tracking freighter losses
* pirate gangs
* Drop an occasional clue if the player is killing any pirate.
* Mordan4 if a player owned ship kills an independent trader, we try to set relations back to 0. That way, if you have any ships set to attack all enemies, they won't automatically kill more traders.
* Renegade ship death.
* Renegade ships spawned in random unknown sectors throughout the game (roamers) are the only renegades in the RenegadeShipList. These are the ones that drop clues,
* and drop rewards. Other renegade ships are solely those owned by the main Renegades Station and used for invasions. Those are not in this list and do not drop clues or loot
* because no clues are needed if a player is already killing one, and only the roamers are 'collecting bribes' from commonwealth ships, not the renegade home fleet.
* Mordan9 fix
* Abandoned ships can also be [Unknown], so check if it's a valid renegade
* $t = 'Renegade ' + [THIS] + ' was disposed of in sector ' + $sector
* display subtitle text: text=$t duration=3000 ms
* If the player manages to kill a renegade ship, we need a reward.
* Note, this does not include renegade ships in the Renegades plot sector.
* Because this is hard out in a remote sector, reward far more if not in a player sector.
* Reward - Drop the motha-load of Crystals.
* If in a player sector, it's easy for the player to kill us so make reward far less.
* If not on hard difficulty, it's easy on the player and reward is less.
* Drop a clue
* Mayhem: if we have followers, select a new leader.
* If we are in a formation, we must re-assess our chance of survival, and retreat if needed.
* Zero Hour
* Coordinated Invasion member never retreat
* Xenon invaders. Reform a group with local ships when leader is killed.
* Terracorp Intergalactic Storage Dropship.
* Herobetty 5.4: What if a black market ship is destroyed while it isn't owned by anyone? It needs to be removed from the list as well.
* Abort the mission so that it's no longer in the mission log.
* Station anti-collision system.
* Mordan
* If this is a player owned ship, and not the player's ship and it was killed by the player, we're going to assume it's a collision and not desired.
* Offset the location of the replacement ship by a certain amount on the Z-Axis. There is no guarantee this position will be better, but it very likely is.
* recreate the ship in it's new position.
* Worker auto-replace.
* teleport
* Zero Hour 1.10 - it is illegal to self-destruct your own OCV ships. They must join the OCV or die from fighting some other faction
* A mercenary leader dies. Regroup is managed into 'Mayhem.Task.Merc.Follower'.

line.text: 'A mercenary leader you hired has been killed in '

line.comment: * === KILLER EXISTS ONLY ===
* Zero Hour 2.0
* Phanon ignores player attacks unless he joined the OCV
* Terraformers ignore player attacks if he joins them
* Zero Hour: player being held accountable for kills scored by hired Mercs
* killing the hive queen.
* Hive Queen.
* Reprisal.
* Company penalty (Player only).
* if $killer.owner == [Player] AND [OWNER] == [Private Corp.]
* Zero Hour replaces rep penalty with infamy penalty
* $races = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetCommonwealth' :
* for each $race in array $races
* = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.AddReputation' : race1=$race race2=[Player] reputation=-500
* end
* end
* Break the truce with player if any.

line.text: 'During a crisis you destroyed a ship of the '

line.comment: * neutral trader
* this source of infamy caps out
* if [THIS]-> is in active sector
* Mordan4 - extend message.
* end
* refugee ship
* do if [THIS]-> is in active sector
* mobile factory
* do if [THIS]-> is in active sector
* Nomad Aran flagship
* do if [THIS]-> is in active sector
* random loyalty
* Xenon count (ascension purpose).
* Herobetty 5.4: added if-else check for ascension completion. No point in incrementing it if it's already completed.
* OCV bounties (only during global alliance)
* Pirates count (ascension purpose).
* Herobetty 5.4: added if-else check for ascension completion. No point in incrementing it if it's already completed.
* Kill credits (mission).
* Favor point.
* Bounties.
* Set.
* Get.
* START [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.Infobox' : text=$t icon=28 timeout=0 fadeout=0
* Mordan7 - Here we will add a chance for a destroyed capital ship to actually "bail".
* For some reason, small ships (M6 and below) bail through some unseen automatic mechanism, and larger ships never do. However,
* we can try to simulate them bailing. They are destroyed for all intents and purposes above, but they leave an empty ship.
* Mordan8
* To prevent savescumming, for 'most' ships I could find, I set a bail chance when they are created.
* This call will return that boolean if it's present, otherwise it will calculate it on the fly.
* give it a bit of hull back, because technically, it's dead at this point.
* Mordan9 - give a little message just to point out that a capital ship bailed.
* Only do this if the player has a satellite in the sector.
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='%s Bailed !', [THIS], null, null, null, null

sval.val: Self destructing OCV tech is illegal!
A mercenary leader you hired has been killed in
During a crisis you destroyed a ship of the
Satellite Notification, sector %s. A %s has bailed
Removing / ignoring signal doesn't seem to work well...
ZH 2.0 - Phanon quest fails if colony ship dies before a sector has been given to Phanon
Drop an occasional clue if the player is killing any pirate.
Mordan4 if a player owned ship kills an independent trader, we try to set relations back to 0. That way, if you have any ships set to attack all enemies, they won't automatically kill more traders.
Renegade ships spawned in random unknown sectors throughout the game (roamers) are the only renegades in the RenegadeShipList. These are the ones that drop clues,
and drop rewards. Other renegade ships are solely those owned by the main Renegades Station and used for invasions. Those are not in this list and do not drop clues or loot
because no clues are needed if a player is already killing one, and only the roamers are 'collecting bribes' from commonwealth ships, not the renegade home fleet.
Abandoned ships can also be [Unknown], so check if it's a valid renegade
display subtitle text: text=$t duration=3000 ms
If the player manages to kill a renegade ship, we need a reward.
Note, this does not include renegade ships in the Renegades plot sector.
Because this is hard out in a remote sector, reward far more if not in a player sector.
Reward - Drop the motha-load of Crystals.
If in a player sector, it's easy for the player to kill us so make reward far less.
If not on hard difficulty, it's easy on the player and reward is less.
Mayhem: if we have followers, select a new leader.
If we are in a formation, we must re-assess our chance of survival, and retreat if needed.
Xenon invaders. Reform a group with local ships when leader is killed.
Herobetty 5.4: What if a black market ship is destroyed while it isn't owned by anyone? It needs to be removed from the list as well.
Abort the mission so that it's no longer in the mission log.
If this is a player owned ship, and not the player's ship and it was killed by the player, we're going to assume it's a collision and not desired.
Offset the location of the replacement ship by a certain amount on the Z-Axis. There is no guarantee this position will be better, but it very likely is.
recreate the ship in it's new position.
Zero Hour 1.10 - it is illegal to self-destruct your own OCV ships. They must join the OCV or die from fighting some other faction
A mercenary leader dies. Regroup is managed into 'Mayhem.Task.Merc.Follower'.
Phanon ignores player attacks unless he joined the OCV
Terraformers ignore player attacks if he joins them
Zero Hour: player being held accountable for kills scored by hired Mercs
Zero Hour replaces rep penalty with infamy penalty
Break the truce with player if any.
this source of infamy caps out
do if [THIS]-> is in active sector
do if [THIS]-> is in active sector
do if [THIS]-> is in active sector
Herobetty 5.4: added if-else check for ascension completion. No point in incrementing it if it's already completed.
Herobetty 5.4: added if-else check for ascension completion. No point in incrementing it if it's already completed.
START [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.Infobox' : text=$t icon=28 timeout=0 fadeout=0
Mordan7 - Here we will add a chance for a destroyed capital ship to actually "bail".
For some reason, small ships (M6 and below) bail through some unseen automatic mechanism, and larger ships never do. However,
we can try to simulate them bailing. They are destroyed for all intents and purposes above, but they leave an empty ship.
To prevent savescumming, for 'most' ships I could find, I set a bail chance when they are created.
This call will return that boolean if it's present, otherwise it will calculate it on the fly.
give it a bit of hull back, because technically, it's dead at this point.
Mordan9 - give a little message just to point out that a capital ship bailed.
Only do this if the player has a satellite in the sector.
write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='%s Bailed !', [THIS], null, null, null, null
